result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph W Randolph

defendant.name: Randolph, Joseph W
defendant.address: W7086 Pond Rd, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Scheduled for FSSC:

Cases 15CM426 and 16CM38 called together at 11:07am [mo]
Defendant Joseph W Randolph in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

recess:11:12am--reconvene: 11:22am

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1 and #2 of Case 15CM426; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 16CM38


Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Atty. Lippert requests expungement upon successful completion of Probation

The Court finds 973.015 that the Defendant will benefit and society will not be harmed if expungement is granted
The Court does grant expungement conditioned upon successful completion of Probation

On Case 15CM426:
On Count #1 and Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no contact with Leslie Wolff, except third party contact for child exchange, additional contact is permitted only if Leslie Wolff and Agent agree contact is appropriate
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming 
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence towards anyone
--pay statutory costs to include DNA surcharge and domestic abuse surcharge
--to pay $43 in subpoena fees
--attorney fees are to now be paid through Probation 



Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 11:40am
from Attorney Jordan Lippert notifying the Court that he does not forsee the case proceeding trial
Jury trial on June 20/21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Cases 15CM426 and 16CM38 called together at 10:00am 
Defendant Joseph W Randolph in court with attorney Jordan Lippert.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon inquiry of the Court, Defendant indicates that he was unaware of a repayment order for attorney fees.
recess: 10:02am--reconvene:10:10am [to allow Atty. Lippert to speak with Mr. Randolph]

On non-compliance with Attorney Fees:
--Atty. Lippert indicates that Mr. Randolph was confused as to repayment due to the posture of the case
--The Court orders Mr. Randolph to pay $70 today and then begin paying $35 per month beginning 6/1/16 and every month thereafter until otherwise directed by the Court.

On Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification:
--ADA Teuber objects; gives basis.
--argument given by Atty. Lippert
--The Court questions Leslie Wolff
--State's submits Exh #1(handwritten statement of Ms. Wolff)
--The Court denies that Defendant's Motion for Bail modification.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 10:31am

NEXT: As to Both Cases: (1)FSSC on 6/14/16 at 10:30am (2)Jury Trial on 6/20/16 and 6/21/16 at 8:30am ((cases with either be joined for trial or case 426 will proceed on 20th and 38 will proceed on 21st))
Status conference on May 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK[ cases #15CM426 and #16CM38 called at 2:20pm. 
Defendant Joseph W Randolph in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Lippert requests the scheduling of another Status Conference, explaining that he has not yet received discovery due.  
The Court and counsel discuss that Attorney Lippert will likely be able to obtain discovery today.  
Attorney Lippert raises that he is requesting the modification of the Bond conditions, to allow Mr. Randolph to have limited contact with the alleged victim.
recess 2:26pm, reconvene 2:29pm.
On agreement of counsel, the Court modifes the Bond condition that prohibits contact with Leslie Wolf, to allow an exception that Mr. Randolph may have third party contact with Ms. Wolf regarding child exchanges, and to allow an exception for in-court contact for court purposes.
recess 2:34pm.

NEXT:  Status Conference on 5/13/16 at 10:00am
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 1/25/16

Cases 16CM38 & 15CM426 called together at 1:48 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Joseph W Randolph in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jordan Lippert. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

16CM38: 
Court has colloquy with Mr. Randolph re: finances
Court appoints Atty Lippert as counsel of record; with reimbursements to be ordered as those ordered in case 15CM426

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Defendant stands mute; Pleas of "not guilty" entered on Defendant's behalf; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

15CM426: On State's Motion to Modify Bond:
Arguments presented

Court requires a $200 CASH bond, TO COVER CASES 15CM426 & 16CM38, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No possession of dangerous weapons
-No contact of any kind with Leslie Wolf  
(* Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-Booking at JCSD - 16CM38
Recess: 1:58 pm 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 2/17/16 at 8:20 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 3/11/16 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
